etymologies: early 18th century: from corn + cockle (from Old English coccul ‘corncockle’, perhaps via Latin from Greek kokkos ‘berry’)

definitions: a Mediterranean plant with bright pink or purple flowers and poisonous seeds, introduced into Britain and North America. If unchecked, it can be a prolific weed in fields of grain. It is often cultivated as a showy annual.
shortDefinitions: pink-flowered Mediterranean plant introduced into Britain
